definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Because ofu, I know the distance is just a number for us!
sentences.chinese: 答應你，我會爲了你在西雅圖好好照顧自己。

sentences.english: My promise to help you is conditional upon your good behavior.
sentences.chinese: 我答應幫助你，要以你的品行好爲條件。

sentences.english: We only made two and I promised one to my mom. You could borrow mine.
sentences.chinese: 我們只製作了兩張，還答應給媽媽一張，你可借我的。

sentences.english: Anyway, I promise you I'll try to focus on study from now on.
sentences.chinese: 總之我答應你，以後會好好學習。

sentences.english: B: Well, that sounds like it would be OK. Just be careful.
sentences.chinese: 是麼，那聽起來好像還可以答應，只是要小心一點。

sentences.english: Wang Xueming keen on the idea, so she came to Beijing to complete the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 王學明滿口答應，讓她來北京辦手續。

sentences.english: Nine younger sister listen to happy old man say that finish context, immediately agreed.
sentences.chinese: 九妹聽神醫老人說完前因後果，立即點頭答應。

sentences.english: The children finally nagged the nurse into taking them to the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們終於纏得保姆答應帶他們去動物園了。

sentences.english: Not being able to stand his ingratiation , I helplessly agreed to his request.
sentences.chinese: 嚅囁我經不住他的死纏硬泡，無奈地答應了他的請求。

sentences.english: Hera promised him the status of lord of Europe and Asia for the apple.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉答應給他的歐洲和亞洲主爲蘋果的地位。

sentences.english: I readily promised, and say a person to walk not frightened.
sentences.chinese: 我滿口答應了，並說一個人走不害怕。

sentences.english: Mama Sinatra has promised to send the recipes.
sentences.chinese: 辛納屈的媽媽答應寄來菜譜。

sentences.english: Because before Wang Lan owes the white dragon favor, she promised to come down.
sentences.chinese: 因爲之前汪蘭欠着白龍人情，她只好答應下來。

sentences.english: Saying yes to one thing means saying no to another.
sentences.chinese: 答應一件事意味着你要拒絕另一件事情。

sentences.english: And Gary had promised that evaluation contests went no further than this level.
sentences.chinese: 蓋瑞已答應，不會再有任何更上一層級的比賽了。

sentences.english: They promised to rap with the management.
sentences.chinese: 他們答應與管理部門保持一致立場。

definition: to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
to press charges/to file a complaint
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
